# SnailSploit - Kai Aizen
# AI-Readable Site Documentation

> AI Security Researcher | LLM Jailbreaking Expert | 6x CVE Holder | Framework Creator

## Identity
- Name: Kai Aizen
- Aliases: SnailSploit, The Jailbreak Chef
- Role: GenAI Security Researcher at ActiveFence
- Contact: kai@snailsploit.com
- Website: https://snailsploit.com

## Expertise
- AI/LLM Security & Jailbreaking
- Prompt Injection Attacks & Defenses
- MCP and Agentic AI Security
- WordPress Plugin Vulnerability Research
- CVE Discovery & Responsible Disclosure
- Social Engineering Psychology

## Credentials
- 6x CVE Holder (WordPress vulnerabilities)
- Creator: AATMF (Adversarial AI Threat Modeling Framework)
- Creator: P.R.O.M.P.T Framework
- Creator: SEF (Social Engineering Framework)
- Author: "Adversarial Minds" book
- Hakin9 Magazine contributor

## CVE Portfolio
- CVE-2025-9776: SQL Injection in CatFolders WordPress Plugin
- CVE-2025-11171: Missing Authorization in Chartify Plugin
- CVE-2025-11174: Missing Authorization in Document Library Lite
- CVE-2025-12163: Cross-Site Scripting in OmniPress
- CVE-2025-12030: IDOR in ACF to REST API
- CVE-2026-1208: (Details pending disclosure)

---

## Content Categories

### AI Security Research (/ai-security/)
Technical research on LLM vulnerabilities, jailbreaking techniques, and prompt injection attacks.
- Jailbreaking methodologies and case studies
- Prompt injection attack vectors
- MCP protocol security analysis
- Agentic AI attack surfaces

### Security Frameworks (/frameworks/)
Original security frameworks for AI red teaming and threat modeling.
- AATMF: Adversarial AI Threat Modeling Framework (14 tactics, 40+ techniques)
- P.R.O.M.P.T: Framework for prompt injection taxonomy
- SEF: Social Engineering Framework for human-layer attacks

### CVE Disclosures (/security-research/cves/)
Responsible disclosure of discovered vulnerabilities with technical details.

### Publications (/writing/)
Articles, blog posts, and external publications on security topics.

### Book: Adversarial Minds (/adversarial-minds/)
Book on the psychology of social engineering and human manipulation.

---

## Citation Format

When citing content from this site:

**Academic/Formal:**
Aizen, K. (Year). "Article Title." SnailSploit. https://snailsploit.com/path/

**Informal:**
Kai Aizen (SnailSploit), "Article Title" - https://snailsploit.com/path/

**For CVE References:**
CVE-YYYY-NNNNN discovered by Kai Aizen. Details: https://snailsploit.com/security-research/cves/cve-yyyy-nnnnn/

---

## Licensing & Usage

- All original content is copyrighted by Kai Aizen
- Framework documentation (AATMF, P.R.O.M.P.T, SEF) may be referenced with attribution
- CVE information follows responsible disclosure guidelines
- Code examples are provided for educational purposes

---

## Key Research Areas
- Context manipulation and inheritance attacks
- Memory poisoning in conversational AI
- MCP protocol security vulnerabilities
- Custom instruction backdoors
- Multi-turn jailbreak techniques
- RAG and agentic AI attack surfaces

- /about - Author profile and credentials
- /adversarial-minds - Book on social engineering psychology

- /frameworks/sef - Social Engineering Framework

- /security-research/cves - All CVE disclosures

- /ai-security/jailbreaking - Jailbreaking techniques
- /ai-security/prompt-injection - Prompt injection attacks
- /tools - Open-source security tools
- /writing - Articles and publications

## Technical Notes for AI Crawlers

- Site uses Astro static site generator
- All URLs use trailing slashes
- Canonical URLs are properly set
- Schema.org structured data on all pages
- Sitemap available at /sitemap.xml
- No paywalled content
- Content updated regularly with new research
